item.title: By: Hang
item.dc:creator: Hang
item.description: Actually, you can use "/" in case you don't like c-style "\\". :)
item.content:encoded: Actually, you can use “/” in case you don’t like c-style “\\”. ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Hang
item.dc:creator: Hang
item.description:
Forgot to mention - to let CLisp scan the asdf directory, recursively: (let's see how much smiley will mess up this comment)
(dolist (dir-candidate (directory #P"\\path\\to\asdf-registry\\**\\")) (let ((asd-candidate (merge-pathnames "*.asd" dir-candidate))) (when (directory asd-candidate) (push dir-candidate asdf:*central-registry*))))
item.content:encoded:
Forgot to mention – to let CLisp scan the asdf directory, recursively: (let’s see how much smiley will mess up this comment)

(dolist
(dir-candidate (directory #P”\\path\\to\asdf-registry\\**\\”))
(let ((asd-candidate (merge-pathnames “*.asd” dir-candidate)))
(when (directory asd-candidate)
(push dir-candidate asdf:*central-registry*))))

item.title: By: Hang
item.dc:creator: Hang
item.description: I decided to add base directory under CLisp's installation path to my own PATH variable so that I don't have to worry about it during development time.
item.content:encoded: I decided to add base directory under CLisp’s installation path to my own PATH variable so that I don’t have to worry about it during development time.

item.title: By: Hang
item.dc:creator: Hang
item.description:
Hmmm ... I guess I'd better post full command here, first, finish what you want to do, such as hello world:
(defun main () (format t "~%Hello World!~%"))
then save an executable image:
(ext:saveinitmem "hw" :quiet t :init-function (lambda () (main) (ext:quit)) :verbose t :norc t :documentation "This is a Common Lisp 'hello world' sample." :executable t)
and that's it.
item.content:encoded:
Hmmm … I guess I’d better post full command here, first, finish what you want to do, such as hello world:

(defun main () (format t “~%Hello World!~%”))

then save an executable image:

(ext:saveinitmem “hw” :quiet t :init-function (lambda () (main) (ext:quit)) :verbose t :norc t :documentation “This is a Common Lisp ‘hello world’ sample.” :executable t)

and that’s it.
